metadata.title: CVE-2022-44792 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
handle_ipDefaultTTL in agent/mibgroup/ip-mib/ip_scalars.c in Net-SNMP 5.8through 5.9.3 has a NULL Pointer Exception bug that can be used by a remoteattacker (who has write access) to cause the instance to crash via acrafted UDP packet, resulting in Denial of Service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-44792` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetsnmptrapd40 - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.4
libsnmp-base - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.4
libsnmp-perl - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.4
libsnmp40 - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.4
snmp - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.4
snmpd - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.4
snmptrapd - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.4
tkmib - 5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9.1+dfsg-1ubuntu2.4').
